setEntryContentsFromString

public com.google.gdata.data.spreadsheet.TableEntry setEntryContentsFromString(com.google.gdata.data.spreadsheet.TableEntry entryToUpdate,
                                                                               java.lang.String nameValuePairs)
Parses the command line arguments given in the format "title=Table1,summary=This is a test", and sets the corresponding values on the given TableEntry.

Values that are not specified are left alone. That is, if the entry already contains "title=Table1", then setting summary will retain the title as Table1.

Parameters:
entryToUpdate - the entry to change based on the parameters
nameValuePairs - the list of name/value pairs, containing the name of the title.

getDataFromParams

public com.google.gdata.data.spreadsheet.Data getDataFromParams(com.google.gdata.data.spreadsheet.Data data,
                                                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> dataParams,
                                                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> columnMap)
Create a new data object from any data params that were specified. Data params are numrows, startrow, insertionmode and columns. Any attributes that are not specified are left alone. So, if data already has insertionmode=insert, specifying numrows=4 and startrow=12 will leave insertionmode as insert.

Parameters:
data - original data object.
dataParams - new data params to use to update the original data object.
columnMap - map of column index to value used to update the column headers of the table.

addNewEntry

public void addNewEntry(java.lang.String nameValuePairs)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException
Adds a new table entry, based on the user-specified name value pairs. Note that the following parameters must be specified: title, startrow, numrows, columns.

Throws:
com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException - when the request causes an error in the Google Spreadsheets service.
java.io.IOException - when an error occurs in communication with the Google Spreadsheets service.

printAndCacheEntry

public void printAndCacheEntry(com.google.gdata.data.spreadsheet.TableEntry entry)
Prints the entire table entry, in a way that mildly resembles what the actual XML looks like.

In addition, all printed entries are cached here. This way, they can be updated or deleted, without having to retrieve the version identifier again from the server.

Parameters:
entry - the list entry to print

loadSheet

public void loadSheet(java.io.BufferedReader reader)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException
Uses the user's credentials to get a list of spreadsheets. Then asks the user which spreadsheet to load. If the selected spreadsheet has multiple worksheets then the user will also be prompted to select what sheet to use.

Parameters:
reader - to read input from the keyboard
Throws:
com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException - when the request causes an error in the Google Spreadsheets service.
java.io.IOException - when an error occurs in communication with the Google Spreadsheets service.

public void listAllEntries()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException
Lists all tables in the spreadsheet.

Throws:
com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException - when the request causes an error in the Google Spreadsheets service.
java.io.IOException - when an error occurs in communication with the Google Spreadsheets service.

search

public void search(java.lang.String titleSearchString)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException
Searches titles of tables with a text search string, finds tables that match the given title and prints those entries out.

Parameters:
titleSearchString - a string like "Table 2" will look for the string "Table 2" in the title of all tables available on the sheet.
Throws:
com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException - when the request causes an error in the Google Spreadsheets service.
java.io.IOException - when an error occurs in communication with the Google Spreadsheets service.

delete

public void delete(java.lang.String idToDelete)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException
Deletes an entry by the ID.

This looks up the old cached row so that the version ID is known. A version ID is used by GData to avoid edit collisions, so that you know if someone has changed the row before you delete it.

For this reason, the cached version of the row, as you last saw it, is kept, instead of querying the entry anew.

Parameters:
idToDelete - the ID of the table to delete such as "0"
Throws:
com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException - when the request causes an error in the Google Spreadsheets service.
java.io.IOException - when an error occurs in communication with the Google Spreadsheets service.

update

public void update(java.lang.String id,
                   java.lang.String nameValuePairs)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException
Updates an existing entry.

See the comment in delete for why the entry is cached in a hash map.

Parameters:
id - the ID of the row to update
nameValuePairs - the name value pairs, such as "title=UpdatedTitle" to change the table's title to UpdatedTitle
Throws:
com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException - when the request causes an error in the Google Spreadsheets service.
java.io.IOException - when an error occurs in communication with the Google Spreadsheets service.

Parses and executes a command.

Parameters:
reader - to read input from the keyboard
Returns:
false if the user quits, true on exception
